title: Mobile-Based Engineering Language Learning Environment Design: A Learner-Centered Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge and extensive practical experience in the field, foundational technical vocabulary and comprehension of engineering-related texts
context.additional_context: Designing a smartphone-accessible learning environment with real-time feedback through formative assessments. Integrates an engineering glossary and contextual analysis tools to improve learner reading comprehension

learning_goals: Learners analyze and improve the text structure and vocabulary usage of visual interfaces that explain engineering concepts.
Learners apply principles of intuitive navigation design in mobile environments with ≥80% accuracy and evaluate the clarity and expressive effectiveness of user interface text.

Learners plan two 3–5-minute microlearning contents applying **learner-centered design principles** (autonomy, diversity, feedback integration), achieving ≥12/15 points in peer review rubrics (clarity, interactivity, effectiveness). Contents must include accurate use of engineering terminology and contextual appropriateness.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
